content.text:
[@masukomi](@LzTjF5eAVC6xprPMGeNzqEP/EEBIGpM6hDaaY10hrz8=.ed25519) 

The `://` pattern denotes that we have an "authority" section, which is the `domain:port` combination. If you're providing a *location*, like HTTP does, then you use `://` to set the domain and port, but if you're just providing an *identifier*, like the sha256 sum, then you just use `:`. Happy to answer any other questions you have about it!
